sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"片，块，段"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bit, piece, sheet, slice, fragment, scrap
means: bit ： 侧重指微小，一点点，小碎片。
piece ： 最普通用词，多指从整体上分割下来的东西，可大可小。
sheet ： 侧重指平整很薄的一张或一片。
slice ： 多指切得很薄的一片食物。
fragment ： 指破裂的，不完整的，不可完整的碎片。
scrap ： 侧重指废弃的零碎之物。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"抛弃，丢弃"之意。
means: discard ： 指把具体的东西抛掉不要，着重扔、丢的动作。
scrap ： 指抛弃过时不再有用的东西。
shed ： 指毛发、皮肤、叶等经过某种自然的过程而脱落。

sentence.Network_en: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
sentence.Network_cn: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

sentence.Network_en: A crumpled scrap of paper was found in her handbag.
sentence.Network_cn: 在她的手提包里发现了一张皱巴巴的小纸片。

sentence.Network_en: He went to prison for receiving stolen scrap iron.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因为收购偷来的废铁而入狱。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a plural noun denoting fragments of uneaten food): from Old Norse skrap 'scraps'; related to skrapa 'to scrape'. The verb dates from the late 19th cent
late 17th cent. (as a noun in the sense 'sinister plot, scheme'): perhaps from the noun scrape

encyclopedia.content: 音标 [skræp]词典解释名词 n. 碎片，小块[C] Put the scrapsof paper in the wastebasket. 将碎纸片放到废纸篓里。 2. 少量，一点点[S][(+of)] Jimmy does not have a scrapof imagination. 吉米一点想像力也没有。 3. 垃圾，破烂[U] All he could do was sell it for scrap. 他只得把它当废物出售。 4. 片段，选段[C] She read aloud scrapsfrom the letter. 她高声朗读那封信的片断。 5. 锛埓颖粝碌娘級资料，图

entry.def: A scrap of something is a very small piece or amount of it.

example.ex: A crumpled scrap of paper was found in her handbag...
example.tran: 在她的手提包里发现了一张皱巴巴的小纸片。

example.ex: ...a fire fueled by scraps of wood...

entry.def: Scraps are pieces of unwanted food which are thrown away or given to animals.

example.ex: ...the scraps from the Sunday dinner table.
example.tran: 星期天晚餐的残羹剩饭

entry.def: If you scrap something, you get rid of it or cancel it.

example.ex: President Hussein called on all countries in the Middle East to scrap nuclear or chemical weapons...
example.tran: 侯赛因总统号召中东所有国家放弃核武器和化学武器。

example.ex: It had been thought that passport controls would be scrapped.
example.tran: 人们曾认为会放开护照管制。

entry.def: Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use.

example.ex: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
example.tran: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

entry.def: Scrap is metal from old or damaged machinery or cars.

example.ex: Thousands of tanks, artillery pieces and armored vehicles will be cut up for scrap.
example.tran: 成千上万的坦克、大炮和装甲车将被切割成废金属。

entry.def: You can refer to a fight or a quarrel as a scrap, especially if it is not very serious.

example.ex: Billy Bonds has never been one to avoid a scrap.
example.tran: 比利·邦兹经常与球员发生拳脚冲突。

means.word_mean: 1. a small fragment of something broken off from the whole;

sentences.sentence: "a bit of rock caught him in the eye"

means.word_mean: 2. worthless material that is to be disposed of
3. a small piece of something that is left over after the rest has been used;

sentences.sentence: "she jotted it on a scrap of paper"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of fighting; any contest or struggle;

sentences.sentence: "a fight broke out at the hockey game"
"the unhappy couple got into a terrible scrap"
"We quarreled over the question as to who discovered America"
"These tewo fellows are always scrapping over something"
"scrap the old airplane and sell the parts"

example.en: Please don't serve me any of your scrap iron.
example.zh: 请别拿你的什么蹩脚酒给我喝。

auth_sentence.content: He passed on every scrap of intelligence to Moscow.
auth_sentence.res_content: He passed on every scrap of intelligence to Moscow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He passed on every scrap of intelligence to Moscow.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He busted a hand the week before in a...scrap.

auth_sentence.content: She was gleaning every scrap of information she could.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was gleaning every scrap of information she could.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was gleaning every scrap of information she could.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 单片复合体反应时间设备

sentences.en: A lot of scrap metal can be melted down and used again.
sentences.cn: 大量金属碎片可以熔化进行再利用。

sentences.en: I made some notes on a piece of scrap paper.
sentences.cn: 我在一张小纸片上记了一些笔记。

sentences.en: Every scrap of land in the town has been built on.
sentences.cn: 城中的每片土地上都有建筑物。

sentences.en: Every scrap of land is used for growing food.
sentences.cn: 每一小片土地都种上了食物。

sentences.en: The engine has been sold for scrap.
sentences.cn: 引擎被当作废品卖掉了。

sentences.en: She creates sculptures out of scrap materials.
sentences.cn: 她利用废旧材料进行雕塑创作。

sentences.en: He had a bit of a scrap with the boy next door.
sentences.cn: 他和隔壁的男孩有点争执。

sentences.en: He looks like he’s been in a scrap.
sentences.cn: 他看上去好像跟人打过架。

sentences.en: With the closure of the factory, thousands of workers have been thrown on the scrap heap.
sentences.cn: 工厂倒闭，几千名工人被遗弃。

means.word_mean: 废弃,丢弃; 取消; 抛弃; 报废

sentences.en: In the end, the decision to scrap the project was unanimous.
sentences.cn: 最后，大家一致决定放弃这一项目。
